intro: Cupania oshanesiana, commonly known as the Oshanesian cupania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and understories. The botanical features of Cupania oshanesiana make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
